bug.author: taion
bug.summary: tfprof model analyzer ignores scalar parameters
bug.description:
<denchmark-h:h3>What related GitHub issues or StackOverflow threads have you found by searching the web for your problem?</denchmark-h>
Searched issues for "tfprof" <denchmark-h:h3>Environment info</denchmark-h>
gcr.io/tensorflow/tensorflow:1.0.0-rc2-devel-gpu <denchmark-h:h3>If possible, provide a minimal reproducible example (We usually don't have time to read hundreds of lines of your code)</denchmark-h>
import tensorflow as tf
sess = tf.InteractiveSession() v = tf.Variable(0., dtype=tf.float32, trainable=True)
tf.contrib.tfprof.model_analyzer.print_model_analysis(tf.get_default_graph()) This will show total_parameters of 0, despite there being a parameter. <denchmark-h:h3>What other attempted solutions have you tried?</denchmark-h>
N/A <denchmark-h:h3>Logs or other output that would be helpful</denchmark-h>
<denchmark-code>name: "_TFProfRoot" exec_micros: 0 requested_bytes: 0 total_exec_micros: 0 total_requested_bytes: 0 total_parameters: 0 children { name: "Variable" exec_micros: 0 requested_bytes: 0 total_exec_micros: 0 total_requested_bytes: 0 total_parameters: 0 float_ops: 0 total_float_ops: 0 } float_ops: 0 total_float_ops: 0 </denchmark-code>
I believe this is coming from the logic here: <denchmark-link:https://github.com/tensorflow/tensorflow/blob/v1.0.0-rc2/tensorflow/tools/tfprof/internal/tfprof_show.cc#L37>https://github.com/tensorflow/tensorflow/blob/v1.0.0-rc2/tensorflow/tools/tfprof/internal/tfprof_show.cc#L37</denchmark-link> which skips nodes with empty shapes, which includes scalars.

comments.comment: <denchmark-link:https://github.com/petewarden>@petewarden</denchmark-link> does tfprof maintainer have github username? tensorflow/tensorflow/tools/tfprof/
I believe it's <denchmark-link:https://github.com/panyx0718>@panyx0718</denchmark-link> , but I'm not certain.
A fix has been submitted. Will be available in next release
Cool â€“ should we close this issue then, or does that typically wait until the change lands in the public GH repo?
I would suggest you wait until the release. It would be great if you can further verify the fix. Thanks!

<denchmark-link:https://github.com/panyx0718>@panyx0718</denchmark-link> possibly related issue: <denchmark-link:http://stackoverflow.com/questions/42309202/profiling-tensorflow-using-tfprof>http://stackoverflow.com/questions/42309202/profiling-tensorflow-using-tfprof</denchmark-link> (sorry, I'd cc you on email but couldn't find it)

Confirmed this was fixed by <denchmark-link:https://github.com/tensorflow/tensorflow/commit/1849946c09ad93bc2e4f49c658049223e1efe908>1849946</denchmark-link> from <denchmark-link:https://github.com/tensorflow/tensorflow/pull/7539>#7539</denchmark-link> .
